artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunimasa IV; Publisher: Fukuda Kumajirō
catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 505
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: parcheesi board: brick tower on street with people looking out of nearly every window; kites flying in sky; man hanging from balloon in UL throwing confetti; people walking, talking, carrying balloons on the street below; sky is richly colored blue, white, and red; flap at ULC with man descending in balloon throwing confetti placed over similar figure on ULC of print
dimension: 37 3/8 × 14 11/16 in. (94.93 × 37.31 cm) (sheet, vertical tetraptych of horizontal ōban)
inscription:
Signature, Title, Date, Inscriptions, and Seal

scattered Japanese inscriptions
markings: Seal LRC Fukuda Kumajirō at No. 19, Hasegawa-chō, Nihonbashi
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: LRC: Painted by Ichijusai Kunimasa IV / November 1890
title: Sugoroku of Looking Out from Ryōunkaku, Asakusa Park
